elements.name: Edge
elements.summary: Edge Cleanse / Enrich / Conversion entails the conversion of machine readily data from one format to another. An example may be VSAM to SQL, or EBCIDIC to ASCII

elements.name: Rationalization
elements.summary: Data Rationalization consolidates your customer and supplier information in your legacy systems to create consistent, integrated and enhanced master files.

elements.name: Replication
elements.summary: Capture Facility Driven (CFD) replication is the process of making multiple copies of data and storing them at different locations to improve their overall accessibility across a network.

elements.name: Memory
elements.summary: Move to Memory (MtM) pattern propogates data to an in-memory database. This is a database management system that primarily relies on main memory for computer data storage

elements.name: Event
elements.summary: Event-driven architecture (EDA) is a software architecture paradigm promoting the production, detection, consumption of, and reaction to events.

elements.name: Co-existence
elements.summary: The synchronization of data between the legacy and modernized IT estate

elements.name: Virtualization
elements.summary: Virtualization allows an application to retrieve and manipulate data without requiring technical details about the data, such as how it is formatted at source, or where it is physically located, and can provide a single customer view of the overall data.

elements.name: Touch Know
elements.summary: Touch It Know It / AI entails supplementing data with external data to enrich the analytics available to the organization.  In addition, merging AI capabilities with the data to drive further insights.

elements.name: Stability
elements.summary: The Stability pattern provides immediate recover of data loss to support continued business operations via data replication and active recovery

elements.name: Parallel
elements.summary: Parallel Processing splits files into large blocks and distributes them across nodes in a cluster. It then transfers packaged code into nodes to process the data in parallel.

elements.name: API
elements.summary: API Enablement is a REST-inspired technology for reading, writing, and modifying information

elements.name: Blockchain
elements.summary: A blockchain is a decentralized, distributed, immutable and oftentimes public, digital ledger consisting of records called blocks that is used to record transactions

elements.name: Containerize
elements.summary: A data container is a transportation solution for a database required to run from one computer system to another.

elements.name: ETL
elements.summary: Deploy data pipelines leveraging ETL and ELT technologies, thereby eliminating legacy-based applications,
